tv_dialog: The TV blares. Someone's giving a speech.
Player: 'Why does that voice make me want to punch a wall?'
You look up, and your soul leaves your body.
Commissioner: 'As YOUR new commissioner, parking tickets for EVERYONE! YOU get a ticket! Your MOM gets a ticket! Baby in a stroller? YOU GET A TICKET!'
Commissioner: 'But why stop there? Jaywalking? TICKET! Littering? TICKET! Breathing MY AIR? STRAIGHT TO JAIL!'
Commissioner: 'Some call it corruption. I call it a successful revenue stream. BAHAHAHAHA!'
News Reporter: 'May God help us. Back to you, Linda-'
Player: 'THAT'S the psychopath who gave me my ticket and kickstarted all of my debt! He ruined my LIFE and they made him COMMISSIONER?!'
Your left eye starts twitching uncontrollably.
letters_dialog: A stack of threatening letters from the city. Today's gem:
Your unpaid parking ticket now has late fees. On top of the other late fees. With interest.
Pay by midnight or face public humiliation, home seizure, a visit from Officer Knuckles, and much more.
toilet_dialog: Player: 'We don't talk about last night.'
couch_dialog: Player: 'If I sit, I'm not getting back up. Not today.'
garbage_dialog: Your trash can is 60% takeout containers, 40% shame.
Crumpled bills line the bottom. You feel a deep sense of dread.
bed_dialog: Your sheets look like they fought a tornado.
door_locked: Player: 'I should probably find out what's happening in the world first.'
Player: 'But maybe I should check the news or something else in my house.'
door_unlocked: Player: 'Time to have a conversation with the commissioner.'
commissioner: Player: 'Face to face with public enemy number one.'
Player: 'Was this an overreaction to a parking ticket?'
